Understanding the View Manager Utility

On the Cross-Platform client, you can use View Manager to:

  • Copy a folder from one view to another.

  • Copy a folder as a child of another.

  • Synchronize two folders from different views.

  • Copy views from one project to another. The source view can be configured to a particular label or promotion state.

  • Copy a view as the child another.

  • Synchronize two views.

  • Include child folders in operations on folders can include their child folders.

  • Include child views in operations on views.

To use View Manager, you must specify a source object, a target object, a set of options, and an operation, such as copy-to-target or source-to-target.

Depending upon the options selected, View Manager copies file histories, labels, promotion states, and information about who created these objects. Most properties, such as descriptions, are replicated along with the objects.
